Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Vase
Description: Vase made from a fine clay, common, orange-coloured and polished, which was placed at the head of a burial. The body is spherical, the neck narrowed and the lip flaring, like the corolla of a flower. The entire exterior surface as well as a few millimetres of the interior lip are painted in dark red.
